Event.name: Make_acquaintance
Event.definition:
<def-root><fen>Individuals</fen> first encounter each other and make introductions at a particular <fen>Time</fen>, <fen>Place</fen>, or <fen>Context</fen>. The <fen>Individuals</fen> may have known of each other before making introductions. The <fen>Individuals</fen> may be separately construed as <fen>Individual_1</fen> and <fen>Individual_2</fen>. In some cases, there is a <fen>Explanation</fen> of the circumstances which lead to the <fen>Individuals</fen>' meeting.
<ex>Impressed when <fex name="ind1">he</fex> first <t>met</t> <fex name="ind2">Nixon</fex>, he had always thought of him as an intelligent man, and believed that Nixon would take a stand for civil rights</ex>
<ex><fex name="ind1">We</fex> <t>met</t> <fex name="ind2">each other</fex> <fex name="pla">in the university</fex>, worked in the same city and came to KSU together! </ex>
<ex><fex name="inds">Horatio Nelson and Emma Hamilton</fex> first <t>met</t> <fex name="pla">in Naples</fex> <fex name="tim">in September 1793</fex></ex>
<ex>Her name was Jenny and <fex name="ind1">I</fex> <t>met</t> <fex name="ind2">her</fex> <fex name="int">through an online dating service</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time when the Individuals make each other's acquaintance.
<ex>I <t>met</t> my wife <fex name="tim">2 yrs ago</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location where the Individuals make each others acquaintance.
<ex>Bill <t>met</t> his wife <fex name="pla">in Poltava, Ukraine</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Individuals
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The persons (or in rare cases animals) that make each other's acquaintance.
<ex><fex name="inds">My wife and I</fex> <t>met</t> in college working in the theatre and we will have been married for 30 years in June 2000.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Context
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The Event, frequently a social occasion, during which the Individuals make each other's acquaintance.
<ex>The two first <t>met</t> <fex name="con">at a lecture</fex> in 1851.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Individual_1
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The semantically more prominent one of the two parties when the Individuals are realized separately.
<ex><fex name="ind1">Melissa Hurley</fex> had never <t>met</t> her neighbor, Richard Congdon ? the dog owner ? until recently, when she and a reporter knocked on his door.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Individual_2
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The semantically less prominent of the two parties when the <fen>Individuals</fen> are expressed separately.
<ex> Gossip reports say she either <t>met</t> <fex name="ind2">Kennedy</fex> while helping him shop for suits at Calvin Klein, or was contacted by him after he saw her jogging in a New York park </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Intermediary
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A person or social group that connects both of the <fen>Individuals</fen>, with a group member typically introducing the <fen>Individuals</fen> to each other.
<ex>Let's call her Gretchen. I "<t>met</t>" her <fex name="int">through a mutual friend (the same fellow who has wanted me to write this column for the past couple years)</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The state of affairs that leads to the <fen>Individuals</fen>' making each other's acquaintance.
<ex>No, I <t>met</t> him <fex name="exp">because he was also the teacher for the special science fiction class</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The frame element <fex name="Iterations">Iterations</fex> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target.</def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: meet.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make the acquaintance of for the first time
